page.title: 18The New Shopping Centre
page.content: Bingley's new shopping centre was built in the 1970's and provides a traffic free shopping arcade at street level, with a library and restaurant above. As well as the main Post Office, there are two supermarkets, an electricity showroom, betting office, job centre and a variety of food, clothes and other shops. In the middle of the arcade, seats are provided for shoppers and this is a popular meeting place for young and old people. At the end of the shopping arcade is a paved area on which a small market is held on Wednesdays and Fridays. There are seven stalls selling food, clothes and household goods. The market is less busy than it was a few years ago.
